definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: He was declared persona non grata and thrown out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他被這個國家宣佈爲不受歡迎的人並被驅逐出境。

sentences.english: Very low costs mean small farmers are unlikely to be dislodged from the market by competition.
sentences.chinese: 極低的成本意味着小農不太可能在競爭中被逐出市場。

sentences.english: The leftist leader already had expelled the U.S. ambassador six months earlier.
sentences.chinese: 早在六個月前左派領導人已經把美國大使驅逐出境。

sentences.english: The authorities deported her for illegal entry.
sentences.chinese: 當局以她非法入境爲由將她驅逐出境。

sentences.english: Several families have been turfed out of their homes.
sentences.chinese: 有幾家人被逐出了家園。

sentences.english: So if they do complain, they risk being deported.
sentences.chinese: 因此如果她們提出申訴，她們就有被驅逐出境的危險。

sentences.english: The  projector is  subject to rejection and may be ejected from the  project.
sentences.chinese: 投影機有遭到否決的傾向並可能被逐出工程。

sentences.english: This event happened previous to the expulsion of the tyrant Christiern the Second from Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 這一件戰史發生於克利斯蒂恩第二被逐出瑞典之前。

sentences.english: After three requests from the chapter leader, I will be ejected from the club.
sentences.chinese: 在分部話事人重複三次命令後，我將被逐出俱樂部。

sentences.english: Exhaust gases are expelled from the engine by compressed-air scavenging.
sentences.chinese: 廢氣被驅逐出境的引擎的壓縮空氣清除。

sentences.english: The Tang Dynasty the monk misunderstands Sun Wu empty excessive to kill however innocent, chase its a division door.
sentences.chinese: 唐僧卻誤會孫悟空濫殺無辜，將其逐出師門。

sentences.english: So he casts the humans out of the Garden, blocks access to the tree of life.
sentences.chinese: 因此他將人類逐出伊甸園，使他們沒法接近生命之樹。

sentences.english: Banks would also be unable to evict defaulters from their homes without rehousing them.
sentences.chinese: 銀行也不能將拒絕履行債務者未重新安置而逐出家門。

sentences.english: They conspired to drive him out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他們共謀把他逐出國外。

sentences.english: As a result, the poets will have to be expelled from this city.
sentences.chinese: 結果是，詩人將被逐出這座城。

sentences.english: So John, if he had been deported, Yoko would've stayed behind.
sentences.chinese: 所以如果約翰被驅逐出境，洋子將繼續留在美國。

definition: to strike off (the rolls)/to remove from a list/to expunge/to expel
an execution/to put sb to death

to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat
to betray/to desert/to defect from/to turn renegade
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to imprison/to place under house arrest
